item.title: We Welcome a New iMac to the Family
item.description:
It’s Saturday afternoon, and I’m eagerly waiting for a delivery that seems to be taking forever. Finally, after hours of waiting, the FedEx truck arrives, carrying the item I’ve been anticipating for a week: a brand new, customized 24-inch Apple iMac. You might wonder why I’m so excited, considering it took me a year after deciding to buy a new computer to finally order it. After all, I was a dedicated Mac user for over a decade before switching to PCs ten years ago...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/we-welcome-a-new-imac-to-the-family/

item.title: HTC HD2 Smartphone With Movies
item.description:
Have you ever been offered a cell phone with two full-length movies already on it? That’s only the beginning of what the HTC HD2 smartphone for T-Mobile offers. This phone doesn’t just offer entertainment, it delivers it in spades! The massive touchscreen display immediately suggests this phone is designed for multimedia. It boasts a 4.3-inch screen with 800 x 480 pixel resolution. Those specs sound more like a small computer than a phone, and that’s a good thing...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/htc-hd2-smartphone-with-movies/

item.title: LG enV Envy Touch Phone Messaging Machine
item.description:
Do you find yourself desiring a modern touchscreen phone but also require a physical QWERTY keyboard? The new LG enV Touch eliminates this dilemma by offering both! When closed, the “enV Touch” resembles a typical touchscreen smartphone. The exterior features a 3-inch, 800x480 pixel color TFT touchscreen with tactile feedback and customizable shortcuts. However, a hidden surprise awaits inside: a second 3-inch, 800x400 pixel color display. This internal screen, paired with a spacious QWERTY keyboard, prioritizes efficient typing over touch input...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lg-env-envy-touch-phone-messaging-machine/

item.title: LG enV2 Sparks Envy Too
item.description:
The LG enV, nicknamed the “envy phone,” certainly attracted attention. Its successor, the enV2 VX9100, takes it up a notch, especially for those who love texting, gaming, and enjoying media on their phone. The standout feature of the enV2 is its hidden full QWERTY keyboard. No need to fumble with a virtual keyboard on this phone! It boasts a real keyboard with comfortably sized keys. Keep your enV2 closed for calls, just like any other standard phone...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lg-env2-sparks-envy-too/

item.title: From Here to Samsung Eternity
item.description:
It’s a frigid winter day with howling winds and accumulating snow outside. However, right here before me, I’m captivated by a Hawaiian beach scene playing on a screen. A young couple enjoys the crashing waves. It’s so realistic that I’m tempted to step into the picture and join them on the warm sand. Despite knowing it’s just a TV screen, I feel a noticeable warmth. This captivating scene effectively blocks out the dreary winter weather outside my window, showcasing the impressive power of visual suggestion...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/from-here-to-samsung-eternity/

item.title: Laptop Too Big? Try a Tablet
item.description:
Carrying a laptop everywhere would be great if it wasn’t so heavy and cumbersome. While internet-enabled phones address the size issue, their small buttons and screens can be limiting. Ideally, there’s a middle groundâ€”something portable yet equipped for easy internet browsing. This is where internet media tablets come in. The Archos 7, for example, is a top-tier ultra-mobile computer resembling a larger iPhone, with a 7-inch touchscreen offering an 800x480 pixel resolution...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/laptop-too-big-try-a-tablet/
